meanings.sent1: Tommy felt like a donnicker when he forgot his homework again.
meanings.sent2: The teacher scolded the donnicker for disrupting the class.
meanings.sent3: The donnicker thought a tomato was a vegetable, not a fruit.
meanings.sent4: She realized she had been acting like a donnicker all along.
meanings.sent5: The donnicker's actions spoke louder than words.

meanings.definition: To hit or strike someone or something.
meanings.sent1: Please don't donnicker the table with your fists.
meanings.sent2: He donnickered the ball with all his might, sending it flying.
meanings.sent3: The chef had to donnicker the dough to make it smooth.
meanings.sent4: The storm donnickered the trees, leaving a trail of destruction.
meanings.sent5: She donnickered the nail into the wall with precision.

meanings.sent1: The donnicker of thunder startled the children.
meanings.sent2: The donnicker of the slamming door echoed through the house.
meanings.sent3: The donnicker of the old car engine made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: The donnicker of the fireworks lit up the night sky.
meanings.sent5: The donnicker of the alarm clock woke him up abruptly.
